intro: Werauhia haplostachya, commonly known as the pink werauhia, is a species of flowering plant in the Bromeliaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. This herbaceous plant is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that form a dense, water-holding cup. The flowers are typically pink or red, emerging from the center of the leaf rosette. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and is often found in cloud forests.
